title: How far would this CEO go with an unlimited budget?
text:
Life & Leisure Oct 8, 2019 — 9.23am Share

Darrell Hardidge is founder and chief executive at Saguity, a customer experience research and strategy company.

First, business or economy?

Usually economy to save the expense for better experiences. But if it’s a long trip, then premium economy works fine.

Favourite destination?

Europe is always great. There’s so much diversity within a short distance. Just being part of the day to day is a great way to experience how people like to live. Enjoying a coffee in the morning rush tells you a lot about how they behave and respect each other.

Virgin Galactic's carrier plane at Spaceport America: Hardidge would love to do "a quick lap of the planet". AP

Favourite airport?

Singapore’s Changi Airport is the best because there is plenty to do if you have to wait in transit. I have spent a lot of time there exploring the watch and tech shops. I also enjoy the rawness of domestic airports in places like Burma, where you really get the vibe of the community.

If I ran my own airline I would...

Make the customer experience the number one priority. Consumers have a lot of choice and politeness and being of service does not cost a cent more, but makes a world of difference. Travel is tiring and a genuine smile and support goes a very long way.

Where would you go with an unlimited travel budget?

I’d take my closest family and friends to Antarctica on a five-star trip to experience the power of nature in this significant place where so few have been. But ultimately, I would like to do a quick lap of the planet on Virgin Galactic – once they sort out any safety issues.

Worst place you’ve been lost?

New Orleans late at night. It’s a very scary city to find your way around. I’ll never make that mistake again.

Best trip ever?

For my 50th birthday, we spent five weeks in Europe – one week for every decade. We made it a celebration trip and totally indulged. We spent my birthday in Granada, Spain.

Most memorable overseas dining?

Vietnam House, Luke Nguyen’s restaurant in Ho Chi Minh City. The food was sensational.
description: Watch this space, says Darrell Hardidge, founder of customer experience research and strategy company Saguity. He answers our Traveller Q&A.
